channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: “ignoring or downplaying the fervently held beliefs of others is a very easy way to be blindsided by the atrocities committed in their name.” https://t.co/HRWwymmiSF
Good news from outer space. https://t.co/hcLe0XMPCM
A scorcher from Arthur Waskow. https://t.co/BtoMynhgMC
@eddyportnoy I’d love to publish a bilingual collection of soon-to-be-banned-in-Florida dirty Yiddish cartoons. Could you find 99 more?

This, very much this. I just want to add that the below cited David Brooks was awarded a journalism prize by the NY Jewish Week a few years back. It would be nice to see some soul searching from those responsible. https://t.co/0cPWkwCDfq

Signatures just arrived for a second book of translated Yiddish poetry. https://t.co/ZMZGeQPYoa
This will be a deluxe presentation of a work by an already well-known Yiddish poetry. The other title is a true rediscovery.
Note to self: A good publisher acknowledges the community leaders who help sell his books. https://t.co/pfXx0BZOqi
Raises the question: What would BEST YESHIVA WORLD SF look like? https://t.co/6oyM9D4t96
Properly calling out the NYTimes for allowing a top-down right-wing campaign to stuff gay people back into the closet to be portrayed in the passive voice. https://t.co/D6GeYo74Q0
"Meretz seeks return of Galon" https://t.co/GWLdX8Aivx
Yudelson leaves White House post. (No relation.) https://t.co/r08cNF5ngk
@JewWhoHasItAll @shelt27467831 Some of us wear contacts.
@protosemite An important bit of investigative journalism you might want to read. https://t.co/DgJikxcIV9
And... first book of translated Yiddish poetry just acquired for the @JPoetryProject of @BenYehudaPress. To be published in a bilingual edition.
@schraubd @rmneiss Alas poor Avi, the man who said non-Orthodox Jewish clergy should be hated “like vermin” cast into the “enemy” box.
@AD_Lobel Codes as in cryptography or the Shulchan Aruch?

Note the dishonesty of these religiously-raised “Newsweek” opiners. The left has a solution popular with most of the country: ban AR-15s. The right minority keeps blocking it. And the role of the Carson fan girl is to obscure the fact through both-siding it.
But one thing you learn well in a yeshiva or Liberty University is how to obscure facts.
Oops. Forgot to attach the screenshot. https://t.co/Yo8AbaS4DD
@AgunotU @Wikipedia Up to volunteers to step up with accurate, verified information.
@trekonomics You’re thinking of Poison Sumac.
Odd that the billionaire whose top rated TV host spreads antisemitic conspiracy theories minimizes likely antisemitic motives of July 4 massacre. https://t.co/0aoNwF8FNy
Look who got Perchik’s fortune cookie! https://t.co/CVtk3UpPbX

Really amazing that the Jewish community is supporting two laws related to hate crime reporting and weeding out neo-Nazis from law enforcement and the Republicans are almost universally opposed and the conversation keeps going back to "left-wing antisemitism."
This bill passed the House on almost straight party lines and died in the face of the Senate's unconstitutional supermajority requirement on straight party lines. https://t.co/LBSQtybPk1
The even less ambitious Khalid Jabara and Heather Heyer National Opposition to Hate, Assault, and Threats to Equality Act, which would incentivize local police departments to report hate crimes, is similarly DOA due to Republican opposition.
It has 90 Democratic an 15 Republican cosponsors in the House; in the Senate, only two of its 24 cosponsors are Republican. https://t.co/nJPabw5Maf
Meanwhile, JFNA says its recent top lobbying priorities were antisemitism and hate crime laws, including these, but their whole press release is a paen to foreign issues and domestic bipartisanship. https://t.co/GZ2bGfy0fl
@nathangoldman @Jacob_Labendz Mazal Tov!
